snippet: Legislation to allow a technology called microstamping has been opposed in several states, but proponents say it would speed up the identification of firearms used in crimes.
abstract: Microstamping, a technique that could make it easier to identify a firearm used in a crime, has been swept up in the national debate over gun laws and Second Amendment rights, stalling efforts to require gun makers to use the method; legislation to require the use of microstamping has been met by fierce opposition from the gun industry and the National Rifle Assn in several states.
lead_paragraph: Legislation to allow a technology called microstamping has been opposed in several states, but proponents say it would speed up the identification of firearms used in crimes.

headline.seo: Code on Shell Casings Sparks a Gun Debate
headline.main: Method to Track Firearm Use Is Stalled by Foes
headline.print_headline: Method to Track Firearm Use Is Stalled by Foes
